key_title: Key to the varieties of Agrostis billardierei

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Glumes and lemma smooth on the sides (but glumes usually scabrous on the keel)
Glumes and lemma scabrous on the sides
Leaf-blades flat or folded, more than 2 mm wide; coastal or sandy areas inland
Leaf-blades involute, less than 2 mm wide; heavy soils away from coast
